section.title: The Miller and his Daughter
section.p: There was once a Miller who lived with his only daughter. His daughter was beautiful with hair like strands of fine gold. She was also talented with the spinning wheel. The Miller was very proud of his daughter and bragged to everyone about how beautiful and talented his daughter was.

section.title: The Miller's Boast
section.p: One day, while the Miller was drinking shopping in the village, he boasted to the bartender shop owner that his daughter was so talented that she could spin straw into gold. One of the king’s guards overheard this boast and returned to tell the king.

section.title: The Daughter is Given a Test
section.p: The king, doubtful of curious about the Miller’s daughter, summoned her to his castle. The king told the girl that he had a test for her to prove her talent. He brought her to a great room filled to the top with straw. The king pointed to the spinning wheel in the middle of the room, telling her that she must spin all the straw into gold by morning or she would be killed punished.
